item.title: How Australia is responding to national shock
Genocide by other means
item.description: THE bombs may have eased, but Palestinian children are still dying. This time, not by Israeli airstrikes, but from cold, and collapsing damaged structures. Israel have violated the ceasefire agreement by obstructing entry of vital services for children, and essential shelters to protect civilians whose homes were destroyed by two years of genocide. A war crime by other......

item.title: Modi’s Victory Day message rekindles tension
item.description: VICTORY Day in Bangladesh is meant to celebrate liberation, sacrifice and national pride. Yet this year, a single congratulatory message from Delhi brought historical questions back into focus. Indian prime minister Narendra Modi’s message, celebrating India’s military triumph over Pakistan, omitted Bangladesh entirely — and in Dhaka, that omission brought underlying......

item.title: Enforcement of int’l rights treaties
item.description: BANGLADESH has ratified numerous international treaties related to human rights. These instruments symbolise the commitment of the country to universal norms of human rights. However, turning these commitments into domestic reality remains a complex challenge. Though the constitution of Bangladesh is rich in fundamental rights, the enforcement of treaty......

item.title: Road map for Bangladesh-India ties post Hasina
item.description: THE fall of Sheikh Hasina in August 2024 reset Bangladesh’s domestic politics and unsettled its most consequential external relationship: India. In the months since, mistrust has deepened, rhetoric has grown inflammatory and both the capitals have taken steps that signal a troubling shift — from what New Delhi once branded as ‘cooperative pragmatism,’ but......

item.title: Smooth supply of medicines for hypertension must
item.description: THE recurring shortage of anti-hypertensive medicines at community clinics expose the fragility of primary healthcare safety programmes. Such a shortage affect the poor and those living in remote areas as the clinics are meant to reduce inequality in access to health care with free medicines and basic services at grass roots. item.title: Strain on relations with India should ease
item.description: THE relations between Bangladesh and India stand further strained over a string of incidents. Such a proposition suggests that the relations have already been strained.
